label: A3B15C5_tP46_127_bh_cg2ij_di-001
title: Tetragonal Potassium Bronze (K$_{3}$W$_{5}$O$_{15}$) Structure
comments:
(Hyde, 1973) notes that this is a derivative of the \href{current_web_home_dir/A3B_cP4_221_c_b-001}{$\alpha$-ReO$_{3}$ ($D0_{9}$) structure}. 
 The measured structure is actually deficient in potassium.  We use the lattice constants from (Magn\'{e}li, 1949) for K$_{0.57}$WO$_{3}$. 
 Magn\'{e}li's X-ray data could not determine the oxygen positions. The coordinates for the oxygen atoms were determined by the requirement that the space group be $P4/mbm$ \#127. as determined by the positions of the potassium and tungsten atoms, and by ``considerations of space.''
